phrases.phrase: Allow guests to view user upgrades
Exclude suggest upgrade for content types
Exclude suggest upgrade for global permissions
Link to account upgrades where content is restricted by permissions
Limit messages to users who have been online in the last X days
Limit messages to valid user accounts
Suggest user upgrades on no permission error
The number of days that alert log records will be kept for. Use 0 to keep the records permanently.
This will allow guests to view the account upgrades page. Clicking on purchase links will redirect the user to the registration page.
The number of days that email log records will be kept for. Use 0 to keep the records permanently.
This will enable a page, linked to in the footer, which will show a list of all sponsors marked with "Show in directory".

The "Suggest user upgrades on no permission error" option will be ignored if the content type that triggered the no permission error is one of these content types. This is helpful if there is a specific content type that you know users are going to see no permission errors for which it is not possible to purchase a user upgrade to bypass.

The "Suggest user upgrades on no permission error" option will be ignored if the global permission that triggered the no permission error is one of these permissions. This is helpful if there is a specific permission that you know users are going to see no permission errors for, for which it is not possible to purchase a user upgrade to bypass.
Note: This option will not work for content permissions (for example, viewing a thread in a forum).
This sets the per page maximum number of total keyword replacements to make for all active keyword replacements. Set it to 0 for unlimited keyword replacements.
This sets the per word maximum number of keyword replacements to make per page. Set it to 0 for unlimited keyword replacements. If there is a limit set on a specific keyword, this value is ignored.

If a user doesn't have the 'View post content' permission or the 'Post snippet length' is set (i.e. not unlimited), and it results in content being restricted, then enabling this option will show a link to the account upgrades page below the restricted content.

This controls the maximum number of each alert that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the total alerts per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited alerts.

This controls the maximum number of each email that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the total emails per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited emails.

This controls the maximum number of each message that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the total messages per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited messages.

This controls the maximum number of total alerts that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period. Set to 0 to allow unlimited alerts.

This controls the maximum number of total emails that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period. Set to 0 to allow unlimited emails.

This controls the maximum number of total messages that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period. Set to 0 to allow unlimited messages.

Communications are only sent to users who have been online within the time frame specified here. This avoids traversing the entire user list on each message cron for performance reasons. You may set this to 0 to disable this limit.
If enabled, the communication crons will skip all users that do not have the valid user state.
The number of days that message log records will be kept for. Use 0 to keep the records permanently.

Enabling this option will require users to purchase a user upgrade or to select a free user upgrade in order to complete their registration.
Note: Make sure that at least one user upgrade is available.
Instead of receiving a no permission error, a user will be shown an upgrade page or a link to view available upgrades.
Maximum viewable posts (requires view thread content)
Post snippet length (requires view post content)
View post content (requires view thread content)
For user upgrades displaying on an upgrade page.
For user upgrades displaying on an upgrade page.
For user upgrades displaying on an upgrade page.
For user upgrades displaying on an upgrade page.
For user upgrades with a shape selected displaying on an upgrade page.
For user upgrades with a shape selected displaying on an upgrade page.
Styling for user upgrades and upgrade pages.
If checked, the keyword will be matched case insenstive.

This controls the maximum number of this alert that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the global/total alerts per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited alerts.
The alert title is not visible to the user.

This will allow users to override the above cost amount when they are purchasing the upgrade.

Note: If you later uninstall [TH] Monetize, recurring upgrades purchased with a custom amount may be rejected.
The custom amount must be no less than {cost}.
An account upgrade is required to continue.
An account upgrade is required to view more of this post.
An account upgrade is required to view more posts.
An account upgrade is required to view this post.
An account upgrade purchase is required to complete your registration.
Apply page criteria to overlays only

Most of the page criteria are not applicable or will not work correctly when applied to the account upgrades page or in place of no permission errors. If you know what you are doing and you would like to apply page criteria in all situations, uncheck this checkbox. Otherwise, we recommend leaving this checkbox as checked.
This will allow an upgrade to be purchased again by the same user, even if their existing upgrade purchase has not yet expired.
Any full part of the domain which must not appear.
The very last full part of the domain which must not appear
The very last full part of the domain which must appear
Any full part of the domain which must appear.

This controls the maximum number of this email that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the global/total emails per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited emails.
Features will be shown as a bullet point list underneath the upgrade description. The bullet point icon styling can be set in style properties above.
The following payment providers do not support zero cost payments: {invalidZeroCost}. Please ensure all payment profiles are valid.
This will add a 'Show more upgrades' link to the default account upgrades page. This is recommended if you are not showing all available and purchased user upgrades.

This will add a link to the following upgrade pages if the user satisfies the user criteria.
Note: page criteria and availability of user upgrades will not be checked.
If checked, the keyword will match, even when it is inside a word. For example both, key and keyword will match the keyword key.
If checked, accents will be ignored when searching for keyword matches. For example both, café and cafe will match the keyword cafe.

This controls the maximum number of this message that can be sent to a user during a specified period. The length of the period should not exceed the log retention period or the global/total messages per user limit. Set to 0 to allow unlimited messages.
If this is unchecked, the overlay will not be able to be closed.
Please confirm that you want to send the following alert
Please confirm that you want to send the following email
Please confirm that you want to send the following message
Replace specific parts of the original link.
Any part of the reference link, including the domain, which must not appear
Replace any part of the original link.
Any part of the reference link, including the domain, which must appear
Inserts affiliate data at the beginning of original link, if the conditions set are met.
Inserts affiliate data at the end of original link, if the conditions set below are met.
The requested upgrade page could not be found.
Send times are based on the UTC time zone.
This will show all available and purchased user upgrades.
This will allow the upgrade page to be shown instead of the default account upgrades page.

This will allow the upgrade page to be shown instead of a no permission error.
Note: this requires the global Suggest user upgrades on no permission error option to be enabled.
This will show the user upgrades page as an overlay on pages that match the pages criteria.
This will show only the below selected user upgrades, sorted by the display orders given.
Users will see the first upgrade page, sorted by display order, for which they satisfy the given user criteria and page criteria (if any).
Upgrade pages must have at least one user upgrade.
Hide the reference links and process them through a gateway. Please note that cloaking can severely penalize your Google rankings.
Encode the reference links in order to meet any affiliate link provider requirements.
User has at least X active upgrades
User has no more than X active upgrades
User has upgrades expiring in no more than X days
User upgrade end date is NOT within X days
User upgrade end date is within X days
User upgrade is NOT one of the selected upgrades
User upgrade is one of the selected upgrades
User upgrade last updated is NOT within X days
User upgrade last updated is within X days
User upgrade start date is NOT within X days
User upgrade start date is within X days
You may enter any amount for this upgrade.
